  • Method Details

    • setRandSeed

      public void setRandSeed(long seed)
      SET SEED FOR TESTING PURPOSES ONLY

    • getPathSize

      public int getPathSize()
      Returns the total number of cells in the flight path.
      Returns:
      the size of the path.

    • getPath

      public Player[] getPath()
      Returns the array representing the flight path. Each index in the array corresponds to a cell in the path and may contain a Player occupying that position.
      Returns:
      an array of Players representing the path.

    • getCell

      public Player getCell(int idx)
      Retrieves the player currently occupying a specific cell in the path.
      Parameters:
      idx - the index of the cell in the path.
      Returns:
      the Player at the specified index, or null if the cell is unoccupied.
      Throws:
      ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is out of range.

    • getStartingPosition

      public int getStartingPosition(int idx)
      Retrieves the starting position of a player given the idx representing order of ship completion

      E.g. first player to finish building will start from getStartingPosition(1)

      Parameters:
      idx - the index in the starting position list.
      Returns:
      the starting position of the player.
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is out of range.

    • occupyCell

      public void occupyCell(int cell, Player player)
      Places a player at a specific cell in the flight path.

      The cell index is wrapped around using modulo arithmetic to ensure it remains within the valid range. The player's current cell is updated accordingly.

      Parameters:
      cell - the target cell index.
      player - the player to place in the cell.

    • freeCell

      public void freeCell(int cell)
      Frees a specific cell in the flight path, making it unoccupied.

      The cell index is wrapped around using modulo arithmetic to ensure it remains within the valid range.

      Parameters:
      cell - the index of the cell to free.

    • move

      public int move(Player player, int delta)
      Moves the player along the path by a specified number of steps, wrapping around the path when necessary. If the player completes a full loop of the path, the loop counter is updated accordingly.
      Parameters:
      player - The player object to be moved.
      delta - The number of steps the player should move. A positive value moves the player forward, while a negative value moves the player backward. The path wraps around when the player moves past the end or beginning of the path.
      Returns:
      The new cell index that the player occupies after the move.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - If the player's current cell is invalid or null in the path.

    • getMostBeautifulShipCredits

      public int getMostBeautifulShipCredits()
      Returns:
      The number of credits associated with the most beautiful ship.

    • rollDices

      public int rollDices()
      Returns:
      sum of 2 rolled dices

    • startTimer

      public void startTimer()
      Starts the timer

    • isTimerExpired

      public boolean isTimerExpired()
      Checks whether the timer has expired.
      Returns:
      true if the current system time is greater than or equal to the timer end time, false otherwise.

    • getTimerFlipsUsed

      public int getTimerFlipsUsed()
      Gets the number of times the timer has been flipped.
      Returns:
      the number of timer flips used.

    • getTimerFlipsRemaining

      public int getTimerFlipsRemaining()
      Gets the remaining number of flips allowed.
      Returns:
      the number of remaining timer flips.

    • createAdventureCardsDeck

      public List<Integer> createAdventureCardsDeck(Game game)
      Creates and returns a deck of adventure cards for the game.
      Parameters:
      game - the game instance for which the adventure cards deck is to be created
      Returns:
      a list of integers representing the adventure cards deck

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object

    • draw

      public String draw()
      Executes the draw operation and returns the result as a string.
      Returns:
      the string representing the outcome of the draw operation

    • center

      public String center(String s, int width)
      Centers a given string within a specified width by adding leading and trailing spaces. If the string's length is greater than or equal to the specified width, it will be truncated.
      Parameters:
      s - the input string to be centered; if null, an empty string will be used
      width - the total width within which the string will be centered
      Returns:
      the centered string, padded with spaces if necessary, or truncated if the input exceeds the specified width
